subject: Law
title: Age Discrimination in Employment
description: A quick win: understand Age Discrimination in Employment.

hook.text: A company lays off its highest-paid employees. They're all over 50. Coincidence? The ADEA says prove it.

buildup.text: The Age Discrimination in Employment Act (1967) protects workers aged 40 and older from age-based discrimination.

discovery.text: It covers hiring, firing, pay, promotions, and any other term of employment. Mandatory retirement is mostly banned.

twist.text: Unlike Title VII, age discrimination plaintiffs must prove age was the 'but-for' causeâ€”a higher burden of proof.

climax.text: Tech companies face growing scrutiny as age bias claims rise in an industry that prizes youth.

punchline.text: Experience has legal protection. Ageism is illegal, even when it's subtle.
